TopicTitle: What resolution do you play KSP at?

Articles.Content:
That's very interesting about the CRTs!

1280x1024 is actually very nice for KSP, since most rockets are vertical. The only problem is that the GUIs (stock & mod) are a bit big since most people have more screen real estate. But in the editors the resolution really shines. Not a huge number of pages of parts, and they're right near the working area.

Go all in and put your monitor in portrait mode. I don't have a desk suitable for it, but some acquaintances from IRC have done so and they say it works very, very well.

Majorjim, I believe you will have to set the resolution manually by editing the settings.cfg file to make it work.

Many monitors will have VESA Mount screw holes on the back. That can be used to attach the monitor to an alternative mount. They're most often used for wall mounting I think but you can get aftermarket desk mounts too. Came in handy for one of our TVs after I cracked the original flimsy plastic stand, the replacement mount is built like a tank!

Sadly not all displays have them. My 1080p screen doesn't seem to.
